title: Who's Who In the Dune: Part Two Trailer
description:
2021’s Dune did a great job of adapting a dense science fiction novel, but it only gave us half the story. That’s where Dune, Part Two comes in. This highly anticipated sequel covers the second half of Frank Herbert’s original novel, and it introduces a lot of new characters in the process.

Who are these new faces in the Dune-verse? How do they shake up an already complex storyline? Why exactly is Paul riding a Sandworm? Here’s what you need to know about Dune, Part Two after watching the first trailer.

Dune: Part Two stars Timothée Chalamet, Zendaya, Rebecca Ferguson, Josh Brolin, Dave Bautista, Stephen McKinley Henderson, Stellan Skarsgård, Charlotte Rampling, Javier Bardem, Austin Butler, Florence Pugh, Christopher Walken and Léa Seydoux. The film hits theaters on November 3, 2023.

title: Call of Duty: Warzone 2.0 - Official Ranked Play Trailer
description:
Ranked Play is coming to Call of Duty: Warzone 2.0 when Season 3 Reloaded kicks off on May 10, 2023. Watch the latest trailer to see what to expect.

#IGN #Gaming #CallOfDuty

title: Trepang2 - Official SPAS-12 Shotgun Trailer
description:
The latest trailer for Trepang2 showcases the SPAS-12. In Trepang2, step into the role of a newly enhanced super soldier on a mission of death, destruction, and revenge. Trepang2 will be available on PC on June 21, 2023.

#IGN #Gaming

title: Shadowman: Darque Legacy - Official Reveal Trailer
description:
Shadowman: Darque Legacy is an action-horror game based on the comic series. Shadowman must stand up against horrifying enemies that threaten the land of the living with melee combat that offers players a challenge. Cross between the living realm and the Deadside dark realm to become the hero of the dark and overcome obstacles to slay foes in your path. Shadowman: Darque Legacy is launching in 2024 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series S|X, and PC.

#IGN #Shadowman #Gaming

title: Apex Legends - Official Ballistic Character Trailer
description:
Meet Ballistic and learn more about the character in this new trailer for Apex Legends, including the latest Legend's combat skills, like his Sling passive ability, Whistler tactical ability, and Tempest ultimate ability.

#IGN #Gaming #ApexLegends

title: Rogue Squadron is Top Gun Meets Star Wars, So Why Can't Disney Get it Off the Ground?
description:
Top Gun: Maverick proves Star Wars: Rogue Squadron could work, so why can't Disney make it happen? Rogue Squadron was supposed to release in December 2023 but little has been seen of it since its announcement, leading to speculation that it was quietly canceled. However, Lucasfilm president Kathleen Kennedy continues to insist that we could still see a Rogue Squadron movie. With Tom Cruise proving the blockbuster appeal of aerial dogfights in 2022's Top Gun sequel, now is exactly the right time for a Star Wars X-Wing and TIE Fighter movie.

#IGN #Movies #StarWars

title: Requisition VR - Official Launch Trailer
description:
REQUISITION VR is a first physics-based VR co-op game where you can use duct tape to link any objects together to create a unique weapon. You can experiment with crafting, connecting any unthinkable combinations: a katana + a circular saw, or an axe + a ball. Inspired by Dead Rising & Walking Dead: S&S

#IGN

title: Amnesia: The Bunker - Official 10 Minute Gameplay
description:
Check out 10 minutes of gameplay from Amnesia: The Bunker, including a terrifying exploration of some dark areas, a peek at some problems you'll encounter, and ways to handle survival in this upcoming first-person horror game.

Amnesia: The Bunker is set in a desolate WW1 Bunker, where you face the oppressing terrors stalking the dark corridors. Search for and use the tools and weapons at your disposal, while keeping the lights on at all costs. Overcome fear, persevere, and make your way out alive.

Amnesia: The Bunker, the latest installment in the Amnesia series, will be available on PC, Xbox, and PlayStation on May 23, 2023.

#IGN #Gaming

title: Jedi Survivor’s Lack of Morality Makes it More Fun - Beyond Clips
description:
Star Wars: Jedi Survivor (and Fallen Order) both do an excellent job gamifying the fun parts of being being a Jedi Knight - using the Force, having a Lightsaber, doing flips all over the place - but thankfully, one thing that the studio hasn’t tried to turn into a mechanic is the complex moral challenges of following the Jedi Code. The original Dark Forces II: Jedi Knight did a great job letting players feel like a Jedi, but they also docked them good guy points for choosing/using Force powers associated with the Dark Side, and let’s be real: those are the ones that make for the most fun gameplay. Knights of the Old Republic’s entire narrative is determined by the player making light side or dark side choices, it’s an RPG, not an action game. The Force Unleashed, meanwhile, was fundamentally about using The Force to kick someone’s ass, but it also wasn’t a conventional hero’s journey, as you controlled Galen “Starkiller” Marek. Despite occasional dalliances with the Dark Side, Cal is a hero. He’s a Jedi, and a survivor, and sometimes surviving means bending the occasional Jedi rule - and Jed: Survivor is an action adventure video game, so it’s for the best that players aren’t punished for having a good time.

#IGN #StarWars

title: Star Wars: Visions - Volume 2 Exclusive Behind the Scenes Clip (2023) Kathleen Kennedy, James Waugh
description:
Star Wars: Visions is an animated anthology series featuring celebratory expressions of Star Wars storytelling. Seven Japanese anime studios brought their unique talents and perspective to “Star Wars: Visions - Volume 1.” Launching in 2023, Volume 2 will feature stories from creative teams from Chile, France, Japan, India, Ireland, Spain, South Africa, South Korea, the U.K., and the U.S. to showcase the incredible animation happening across each country and culture, through the mythos of Star Wars. Star Wars: Vision - Volume 2 premieres exclusively on Disney+ on May 4, 2023.

#IGN #StarWars

title: Tears of the Kingdom Q&A: Your Questions Answered - NVC Clips
description:
In this clip from Nintendo Voice Chat Presents: Talk of the Kingdom, the crew answers some of your burning questions about The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom! For the next 6 weeks, IGN's flagship Nintendo show, NVC, is getting a FULL Zelda takeover with our very special NVC: Talk of the Kingdom 6 episode mini-series! We'll be talking all things The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom with hands-on coverage and special insight from our guides team and Zelda experts from all across IGN.

#IGN #Gaming #Nintendo

title: Redfall - Which Character Should You Choose?
description:
Redfall throws you headfirst into a nightmarish world filled with cultists, vampires, and surreal psychic projections. Overcoming the chaotic forces of evil in this once quaint Massachusetts town requires careful strategy and exceptional sets of skills. Thankfully, four brave souls possess the abilities and willpower to bite back against the intimidating Vampire Gods. For aspiring stake-plunging heroes of the night, let's break down which character you should choose in Redfall.

00:00 - Intro
00:34 - Meet the Vampire Slayers
02:02 - Redfall Character Breakdowns 
02:15 - Jacob Boyer - Sniper
03:38 - Layla Ellison - Wild Card
05:07 - Devinder Crousley - Crowd Control 
06:36 - Remi De La Rosa - Support 
08:08 - Outro

#IGN #Gaming

title: Star Wars Jedi: Survivor - The Best Skills to Unlock First
description:
As you defeat Stormtroopers, Raiders, Creatures and Battle Droids in Jedi Survivor, you’ll earn Skill Points which you can spend to unlock new abilities for Cal, but you’re presented with so many options from the start, and you unlock more and more choices as you go; it can be hard to know where to focus your skill points! Don’t worry, we’re here with the Best Skills To Unlock First in Star Wars Jedi: Survivor.

Timestamps:

00:27 - How to Reset All Skills
01:19 - Improved Stim Formula
02:00 - Wrenching Pull
02:25 - Lunging Strike, Gathering Tempest, Backstep Slash
02:55 - Twofold Reflection/Split Reflection
03:45 - Greater Confusion

05:20 - Single-Blade Stance
06:09 - Double-Blade Stance

For more on Jedi Survivor, including our interactive map, walkthroughs, boss guides and more, head to our written guide on IGN.
https://www.ign.com/wikis/star-wars-jedi-survivor/

title: Why Order 66 Was The Emperor's Biggest Failure
description:
Order 66 is a turning point in the galaxy of Star Wars. Order 66 may be the one moment in galactic history shown the most in Star Wars! Darth Vader started his path with Order 66, scene after scene showing his dark descent. But Order 66 wasn’t exactly the magnum opus that Emperor Palpatine thought it was. Why? Because a whole bunch of Jedi survived to fight the Empire and keep the Jedi religion alive. So how did The Empire fumble the bag this badly? Join us as we break down the Emperor’s biggest failure.

In The Bad Batch, Order 66 is the inciting scene, as is Clone Wars. Order 66 seems pretty thorough- to kill the Jedi, but it actually wasn’t enough; so many survived Order 66, Theme wise, it’s not just about the Jedi who survived Order 66, but the spirits to resist and fight were also Order 66 survivors. Though it traumatized Grogu, Order 66 did not kill him and he and others endured beyond Revenge of the Sith and the scourge of Anakin Skywalker and the Clone Wars remnants. The legend of the Jedi is powerful enough in Star Wars lore, empowering those like Ahsoka Tano. Order 66 may have been intended to extinguish the Jedi, but through the eyes of Obi-Wan Kenobi, Order 66 was just a jumping point.

There are also those like Reva; Order 66 may have affected her, but she’s capable along with all known Jedi who survived Order 66, to make a comeback to the side of light. Who survived Order 66 is an ever changing question– the door is never shut and there are more added to all Jedi that survived Order 66. The Jedi that survived Order 66 have way more power than the Emperor could have ever imagined, and are so much more than the sum total of every single Jedi that survived Order 66. The number and the value is incalculable for the Jedi Order and the forces who oppose Emperor Palpatine and what the Empire represents.

#IGN #StarWars

title: Crater - Official Clip (2023) Isaiah Russell-Bailey, Mckenna Grace
description:
Check out the new Crater clip from the upcoming Disney Plus movie. This coming-of-age adventure follows the story of Caleb Channing, who was raised on a lunar mining colony and is about to be permanently relocated to a faraway planet following his father's death. However, before his departure, he and his three best friends, along with a new arrival from Earth, hijack a rover for one final adventure as they explore a mysterious crater.

Starring Isaiah Russell-Bailey, Mckenna Grace, Billy Barratt, Orson Hong, Thomas Boyce, and Scott Mescudi, Crater will be available to stream on Disney+ on May 12, 2023.

#IGN #Movies #Disney

title: Redfall Review
description:
Redfall reviewed by Luke Reilly on Xbox Series X. Also available on PC.

"Redfall is a bafflingly bad time across the board, whether playing solo or with a friend or three suffering alongside you. That it comes in the wake of Arkane’s excellent Deathloop, the enduringly beloved Prey, and the acclaimed Dishonored series honestly beggars belief. Its performance on Xbox Series X is regularly dire, plagued with pop-in, stutters, and a long list of display bugs. It’s beleaguered with bodgy AI enemies that struggle to mount a basic defence, choose appropriate cover, or even effectively navigate the world. The one-note mission design recycles and repurposes itself all the way until the anticlimactic final encounter. Button commands break, characters vanish, and the cheap and static story scenes seem woefully unfinished by typical standards. There may be occasional glimpses of a competent co-op shooter on display but otherwise, Redfall is just like a vampire in all the wrong ways. That is, it really wasn’t ready for daylight in this state, and it sucks."

Spider-Man: Across The Spider-Verse, Is 2+ Hours Too Long? - IGN Now
description: The Spider-Man: Across The Spider-Verse is reportedly longer than any other Hollywood animated feature film, and it’s only Part One of an expected two-part Spider-Verse movie slate. Insomniac Games’ Spider-Man 2 video game is getting a prequel in the form of a comic book tie-in, which is perfect for #Marvel fans who are curious to know what’s going on with Peter Parker, Miles Morales and MJ before the game’s sequel. And finally, Xbox announces their “Summer” showcase for Sunday, June 11, with a Starfield Direct following. But with the reported problems plaguing Redfall, how’re gamers feeling towards the Xbox exclusive? #SpiderVerse
